item.title: Jayda add a quote by Jonathan Larson
Jayda add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I've learned that regardless of your relationship with your parents, you'll miss them when they're gone from your life." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Jayda add a quote by Morrissey
item.description: "So the life I have made May seem wrong to you But, I've never been surer It's my life to ruin My own way..." -- Morrissey

item.title: Jayda add a quote by Luigi Pirandello
item.description: "THE FATHER: But don't you see that the whole trouble lies here? In words, words. Each one of us has within him a whole world of things, each man of us his own special world. And how can we ever come to an understanding if I put in the words I utter the sense and value of things as I see them; while you who listen to me must inevitably translate them according to the conception of things each one of you has within himself. We think we understand each other, but we never really do." -- Luigi Pirandello

item.title: Jayda add a quote by William Shakespeare
Jayda add a quote by Elizabeth Cary
Jayda add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description:
"It was the dream itself enchanted me: Character isolated by a deed To engross the present and dominate memory. Players and painted stage took all my love, And not those things that they were emblems of.
[from "The Circus Animals' Desertion"]" -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Jayda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jayda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jayda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jayda add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "But who can remember pain, once it’s over? All that remains of it is a shadow, not in the mind even, in the flesh. Pain marks you, but too deep to see. Out of sight, out of mind." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jayda add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I feel like cotton candy: sugar and air. Squeeze me and I’d turn into a small sickly damp wad of weeping pinky-red." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jayda add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I feel like the word shatter." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jayda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jayda add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Jayda add a quote by William Shakespeare
